content.description:
Smear Tactics 5.9 ** (100') F(8b)

Begin about 10' up and right of "Brown Shoes..." Climb the nubbiny/blank slab to share the chain anchors with "Brown Shoes..."
content.location: Begin from the main ledge about a third of the way up the main face, just left of the service berry clump.

content.description:
THE SHIELD DIRECT 5.10a ** (160') F (8b)

A great long slab climb. Begin at the left end of the lower face (by the aspen tree), climbing friction and small nubbin moves to the big ledge (5.11a if the crack is seeping). Continue up the easier upper face on excellent rock to the 2 bolt anchor. 30' of 4th class leads to the top which is easy to walk off of to the south.

Upper slab can be climbed alone (possible then to lower from top anchors with a 60m rope) - 5.9 PG ** 100' F(5b).
content.location: The long slab at the left end of the Shield.

content.description: Climb the face right of Next To Nuthin, up the low angled lower slab to the steeper, blanker upper section.
content.location: On the slab in the middle of the lower face.

content.description:
Next To Nuthin' 5.11 (80') TR

Begin 15' right of Alkahest at the base of the main face and climb up and over the arching crack to the mostly blank (crux) upper section. 2 anchor bolts are above the top ledge.
content.location: Climbs the left side of the sweeping slab in the middle of the lower face.

content.description:
Brown Shoes Don't Make It 5.8 ** (105') F(7b)

At the far left end of the upper slab begin on the big nubbins and follow the brown hangers directly up the mostly featureless slab to the 2 chain anchors below the top. Possible to lower from top anchors with a 60m rope.
content.location: At the far left end of the upper face on the ledge that bisects the lower face. Belay at the single bolt (black) anchor.

content.description:
Alkahest 5.7 ** 55' F(3b)

Begin 10' right of the Shield Direct route at the left end of the Shield slab, climbing up the water streak on big nubbins, over the undercling crack and on to the big ledge with the 2 cold shut anchors. May be a grade harder for a short climber.
content.protection: Fixed - 3 bolts (medium cam and several nut placements near the top are possible, but not essential)
content.location: At the left end of the Shield, beginning about 10' right of the Shield Direct
